newsitem.title: JAPAN: Sony says no decision yet on size of JSkyB stake.
newsitem.headline: Sony says no decision yet on size of JSkyB stake.

text.p: Sony Corp said on Tuesday it had not yet made a decision on the size of its stake in Japan Sky Broadcasting Co, or JSkyB.

Asked to comment on a Japanese newspaper report that Sony is likely to take a 25 percent stake in the satellite TV partnership, a Sony spokesman said that the firm had not yet decided on such details.

The financial daily Nihon Keizai Shimbun reported in its afternoon edition on Tuesday, without identifying any sources, that Sony was likely to take a quarter stake and that a formal announcement will be made soon.

The Sony spokesman also said said he could not give any likely timing for an announcement by Sony on the details of its participation in the digital satellite joint venture, whose other partners are Rupert Murdoch's News Corp and Japanese software publisher Softbank Corp.
On Monday, Murdoch told a news conference in Tokyo that the three companies were negotiating as "equal partners" over how to launch the project.
Softbank president Masayoshi Son also told the same news conference that the three firms had basically agreed to become equal partners in the project.
But analysts are watching whether Sony, as a latecomer to the project, will be able to become an equal partner in the planned JSkyB venture.

Industry sources said Softbank president Masayoshi Son hopes to take the lead in the satellite broadcasting venture and is pushing for Sony to take a stake of about 25 percent, rather than the 33 percent that Sony is seeking.
